title: Romantic 3-page interactive Valentine flow (proposal ‚Üí celebration ‚Üí future family)

requirements.summary: Create a 3-page responsive client-side flow with default Page 1, Yes‚ÜíPage 2, and Continue‚ÜíPage 3 navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: Opening the app lands on Page 1.
Clicking/tapping a ‚ÄúYes‚Äù button on Page 1 always navigates to Page 2.
Clicking/tapping ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù on Page 2 navigates to Page 3.
Layout works on mobile and desktop without overlapping or off-screen primary content.

file_operations.description: Implement lightweight in-app routing/state for Page 1 ‚Üí Page 2 ‚Üí Page 3 flow; ensure initial route is Page 1 and wire navigation handlers (Yes/Continue) to switch pages.
Create Page 1 view component exposing onYes callback so App can navigate to Page 2.
Create Page 2 view component exposing onContinue callback so App can navigate to Page 3.
Create Page 3 view component used by App routing.

requirements.summary: Build Page 1 proposal UI with tulips/roses pattern background, top header couple image, exact question text, and Yes/No buttons.
acceptanceCriteria: Page 1 shows a tulips/roses patterned background.
A header image is rendered at the top and is displayed in a way that preserves full-body visibility (no unintended cropping on common screen sizes).
The text ‚ÄúWill you be my Valentine?‚Äù is shown below the header image.
The ‚ÄúYes‚Äù button is visually large, red, and does not move when hovering/tapping elsewhere.
The ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button is visible and clickable/tappable.

file_operations.description: Implement the Page 1 layout: full-page background using frontend/public/assets/generated/tulips-roses-pattern.dim_1920x1080.png; top header image using frontend/public/assets/generated/hugging-couple-header.dim_1200x1600.png displayed with sizing that preserves full-body visibility; render the exact text and the Yes/No buttons. Use the shadcn-ui component library (e.g., Button) to keep consistent button styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement Page 1 ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button evasive movement and click/tap progression text cycle leading to transformation into a second Yes button.
acceptanceCriteria: Hovering over the ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button on desktop moves it to a new random position.
Tapping the ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button on touch devices moves it to a new random position (unless the tap is counted as a successful ‚ÄúNo‚Äù click per the logic below).
The ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button never moves outside the viewport bounds.
The ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button does not overlap/cover the ‚ÄúYes‚Äù button after it moves.
On the first successful click/tap of ‚ÄúNo‚Äù, the displayed header text becomes ‚ÄúThink again‚Äù.
On the second successful click/tap of ‚ÄúNo‚Äù, the displayed header text becomes ‚ÄúLast chance‚Äù.
On the third successful click/tap of ‚ÄúNo‚Äù, the ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button is replaced by a second ‚ÄúYes‚Äù button; both ‚ÄúYes‚Äù buttons navigate to Page 2.

file_operations.description: Add state and event handling for the ‚ÄúNo‚Äù button: random nearby jump on hover (desktop) and touch interactions (mobile), constrained within viewport and avoiding overlap with the stationary Yes button; track successful No clicks/taps to cycle header text (‚ÄúThink again‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúLast chance‚Äù) then transform No into a second Yes with identical style/behavior. Use shadcn-ui Button (if used on Page 1) for both Yes buttons to keep styling consistent; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add utility helpers to compute safe random positions within the viewport and to detect/avoid overlap between the moving No button and the stationary Yes button (bounding-box based).

requirements.summary: Build Page 2 to autoplay background audio from the uploaded song and run a sequential center popup slideshow for the 30 uploaded images.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to Page 2 starts audio playback automatically (subject to browser autoplay policies).
If the browser blocks autoplay, the UI provides a clear, single action to start playback (e.g., a ‚ÄúTap to play‚Äù control).
The popup animation displays each of the 30 uploaded images centered on the screen, one after another, at a consistent pace.
The popup animation works on both mobile and desktop without layout breaking.

file_operations.description: Implement Page 2 audio playback using frontend/public/assets/generated/AUD-20251006-WA0007.mp3 with autoplay attempt and a single, clear fallback control when autoplay is blocked; implement a timed sequence that displays each of the 30 user-uploaded images centered one-by-one at a consistent, readable speed. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button) for the fallback play control to keep styling consistent; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Define the ordered list of the 30 uploaded image filenames (exact names) and the audio filename as constants used by Page 2, ensuring filenames match exactly as provided.
Add a small React hook that attempts audio autoplay on mount and exposes state to show a user-gesture play button when blocked by browser policies.
Add a React hook to drive the popup image sequence timing (index progression, completion state) in a deterministic, consistent pace across devices.

requirements.summary: After the Page 2 popup sequence, transition into a background image grid and render a glassmorphism message overlay with Continue button to Page 3.
acceptanceCriteria: After the final popup, the view transitions to a grid of the 30 images.
The grid is arranged in a readable top-to-bottom flow and remains behind the overlay.
A glassmorphism overlay (semi-transparent with blur) is rendered above the grid, and the grid remains visibly perceptible behind it.
The overlay shows the user-provided message text verbatim (including punctuation and emoji).
A ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù button appears at the bottom of the overlay and navigates to Page 3.

file_operations.description: Add the post-slideshow transition: render the same 30 images in a top-to-bottom background grid behind content after the popup sequence completes; render a glassmorphism overlay above the grid containing the message text (sourced verbatim from a single constant) and a bottom Continue button that triggers onContinue navigation. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card for the overlay container and Button for Continue) to support consistent styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a single exported constant for the Page 2 overlay message text; populate this constant with the exact user-provided message text verbatim (including punctuation and emoji) during implementation.

Create a reusable glassmorphism overlay component (semi-transparent background + blur) used on Page 2 to ensure consistent look and responsive padding. Use shadcn-ui Card (if available) as the base container; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Build Page 3 with a single responsive hero image and the exact footer caption in an elegant font.
acceptanceCriteria: Page 3 shows the generated hero image prominently and responsively.
The footer caption is displayed exactly as specified (including emoji) and remains readable on mobile and desktop.
The page does not overflow horizontally on small screens.

file_operations.description: Render the Page 3 hero image from frontend/public/assets/generated/future-family-scene.dim_3840x2160.png with responsive sizing and no horizontal overflow; render the exact caption text ‚ÄúOur sweet little palak lokesh vishwakrma dubey familyüßø‚ù§Ô∏èü§ûüèªü§óü•π‚Äù directly below in elegant typography.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive romantic theme (warm palette, consistent typography/spacing/buttons/overlays) across all pages with responsive behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages share a consistent romantic theme (colors, typography, button styling).
Theme remains legible and visually balanced on mobile and desktop.
No default/unstyled components remain in the primary UI flow.

file_operations.description: Define global romantic theme styling using Tailwind base layers/CSS variables: warm palette (rose/cream/gold), consistent typography defaults, and shared utility classes for buttons/overlays; ensure responsive text sizing and prevent horizontal overflow.
Extend Tailwind theme tokens (colors, shadows, border radius, animations if needed) to support a consistent romantic palette and subtle decorative accents used across Pages 1‚Äì3.
Wrap pages in a consistent layout container (spacing, max widths where appropriate) and ensure shared button/overlay styles are applied consistently across the three-page flow.
